message.content:
cs.DB, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.CR, cs.AI. 

The paper focuses on the problem of storage allocation for specific workloads in data centers, which is a core issue in database management systems (DBMS). Therefore, cs.DB is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the total operating cost (TOC) of running workloads, which is related to data center management and optimization, suggesting cs.DC as the second likely sub-category. The paper proposes a heuristic-based solution, which falls under the category of algorithm design and analysis, making cs.SY a possible sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of Service Level Agreements (SLAs), which is related to security and privacy, suggesting cs.CR as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper uses experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed solution, which involves machine learning and optimization, making cs.AI a possible sub-category.
